author: jeffg
title: University/College Outreach
description: We need to reach out to university and college students and graduates to raise awareness of Cardano and the opportunities that exist.

assessments.note: Great idea to reach out to college graduates as this is a very crypto enthusiastic group. I would like to see more specifics on which Universities you are planning to target.
It is definetly a good idea to rech for students directly. Young-driven minds can definitely increase the evolution of Cardano ecosystem.

It is unclear from the proposal how advertisement campaigns and twitch streams contribute to attract the brightest entrepreneurs to Catalyst. Higher education in India, China, US, and top 100 universities for devs looks different and it is unclear what market the twitch streams (if even effective) would reach. This proposal may be more suited to support people that just made it into the space, but not necessarily to attract new minds.
If successful this could reach new group of people who might make proposals in future funds.

I really think that for a rapid growth and the explosion of ideas, the more suitable environment is the university, where people from all around the world are living together, sharing experiences and seen each other's problems and thinking about solutions, other than that, they're breathing a environment of change and evolution.  
However, I'm thinking that if these people do not know about Cardano or Project Catalyst, how productive would be sending emails to them. How the students would see receiving an email from something that they don't know. I really thing that they wouldn't open it – since nowadays the selling of private information like email to industries and companies are present, they might receive thousands of emails every day.
I really think that a project more community involved would be of a greater impact. We already have lots of members across the world with great credentials and who are willing to help. Maybe create a platform which put these people together and which aims create a presentation and validate a method that could be presented inside the universities and colleges around the world, but presential – would be much more appealing.
This plan seems optimistic, but feasible. There is a lot of garbage in the crypto space so I see a project like this as a guide to the safe haven of Cardano.

The program is pretty detailed, and I like the idea of self-funding using referral fees. 

I am skeptical about the 1-hour stream daily, it feels overextended. 

The proposer seems to meet the requirements, and the possibility to reach out to student associations is a big plus! But I bet he does not know. nor is part of all of them, so I think that some obstacles might occur with the outreach, and thus decrease the speed to the estimated timeframe.

The experience would affect this rating more positively if interacting with this program (e.g. daily zoom meetings) would be mandatory. Submitting learning plans to staff (and force them to adhere to these) is one thing, creating interest and incentivizing people is a very different story.

It is not clear the proposer has the experience to deliver a successful social media marketing campaign. The proposal states it wants funding for a few months until it come become self funding. However it also states this proposal went into fund4 and if funded there this would be a continuance of funding. These two statements contradict. This raises questions on how well the proposer has though through the funding requirements and thus their ability to to deliver.

As said before, I do believe that you could explore the volunteering feeling that is a natural state of this community and, by doing it, you could reduce the $3k of salary. Other than that, thinking about other approach method than emailing would be of a great help, since it would reduce cost and, in my point of view, more appealing. I really think that explore the people in lots of locations across the world and providing them with a platform to share experiences of presentation in the universities would be a great thing.

Another question that arises is that your proposal is only feasible if you get funded every time (until a point that is self-sustainable), however, lets imagine that you get fund now and in the next one not – will the project over?

Furthermore, it is not clear the intention of deploying a website – what it will be for? What are you aiming with this?

To be blunt, I do not like that salary is the top expense. Nobody should be asked to work for free(wait I am doing that now), but devoting more resources to the outreach campaigns and incentives would make this goal more feasible.

daily outreach of 2 000 - too much IMO
number of ideas submitted- 100/fund way too much 

but hey, the sky is the limit. These metrics are valid and can definitely asses the efficiency of the project.

Since this is purely marketing driven and allocated budget appears to be more for personal use ($1,500 for hardware/software?), I see a severe lack of information on how this proposal would actually be implemented to reach outreach goals.
It is not clear how feasible the plan is. 10% response rate on unsolicited direct mail seems high.

The metrics involving the number of people attending each approach method is a good way to measure success of this proposal.
However, I miss a good roadmap.

solution: We intend to incubate interest in the blockchain by educating them with daily zooms and assisting in proposal development with targets.
experience: A former manager within the federal public service responsible for delivery of national programs and learning plans for new staff.
